Key Match Events: Denver Nuggets lost to the Phoenix Suns backups 118-114
Nikola Jokic and Michael Porter Jr had big nights
The Nuggets let their foot off the gas defensively in the second half
The Suns took advantage and got control of the game
Post-Match Reflections: The Nuggets have yet to win a game this preseason but the team looks ready to roll
Jokic looks in MVP form, the bench additions plus Strawther's growth make for a potent second unit
Depth is the biggest question mark for the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The high level play came from the wings tonight
Julian Strawther had a promising performance
Ryan Dunn was on fire and hit six three pointers
The Nuggets' offense stalled out in the fourth quarter
Zeke Nnaji had some good minutes in the fourth quarter
Others: The Nuggets' starters struggled against the Phoenix bench
Jamal Murray didn't play in the second half due to a knee issue
Coach Malone said he wasn't happy with the team's conditioning and ran the starters in the third quarter
The team is concerned about Murray's health and conditioning
